Subjective: Right eye irritation, onset Tuesday morning; initially thought dust/hair, rubbed eye. Right eye redder, 'little red veins,' thicker than Left eye. Constant feeling of foreign body in Right eye, urge to touch. Pain with hard eye squeeze. Uncomfortable. Vision normal, no light sensitivity. Left eye started redness yesterday. No lenses. No new creams/mascara. No specific injury. No fever, flu-like symptoms, cough, or shortness of breath. Social: Has daughter (Isa), boyfriend away. Working. Impact: Annoying. Request: Wants eye checked, rule out other causes, determine if eye drops/antibiotics needed, concerned about contagiousness for daughter, what if worsens.
Objective: Right eye: Redness, 'little red veins.' Left eye: Redness. No foreign body on bottom or upper eyelids. Pupils react normally to light.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis, bilateral (Right > Left). Self-limiting. No signs of bacterial infection or foreign body.
Plan: Explanation: Viral conjunctivitis, self-limiting, can take up to 2 weeks to resolve.
Advice: Do not rub eyes. No need to rinse with water. Use OTC artificial tears for soothing. Use lukewarm tap water with cotton pad for morning 'stuck' feeling.
Safety Net: Return if no improvement after 2 weeks. Return immediately if: increased pain, more pus, eyes stuck shut more, or vision changes.
